result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 14CF148 & 14CF5. Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:48 am.  CT finds elig for substance abuse pgm, not elig for CIP.  
W/H sentence, probation 2 1/2 yrs.  Undergo cognitive pgm & follow recomm of compas.  $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA surcharge of $300 & must provide DNA sample.  Convicted felon-cannot possess firearm, no body armor, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elective office, if not US Citzen face deporation or lose other citizen rights.  Order 1 year conditional time, serve 60 days to start by 10/3/14, subj to WR, not subj to GT.  Remainder of time is banked.  Atty Smestad to provide court w/ credit for time served-10 days to file w/ the court.  Must report to probation today.  Probation runs concurrent w/ other probation.  
Bond to be applied to fine/costs.  Remainder of bond may be returned to poster.  11:56 am adj.
#1 - Ltr from DA to Atty Smestad re resolution
Sentencing hearing on September 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

CASES: 14CF5 & 14CF148.  Defendant Arthur C Erdmann in court with attorney Brian T Smestad.  Daniel P Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:11 pm.  Exh 1-O&R.  Cannot possess firearm, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold public office, cannot possess body armor.  If not US citizen, face deportation.  
14CF148-Count 1-Def-guilty.  CT-adj guilty, judgement entered.  14CF5-DRI all counts for sentence & restitut.  Order PSI-long form, COMPAS, agent not be present.  PSI due 8/22.  Bond cont. 3:27 pm adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
